sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Iran, officially known as the Islamic Republic of Iran, is a country located in Western Asia. It is known for its ancient civilization, rich cultural heritage, and significant influence in regional history, art, and science.

sections.title: Capital City
sections.content: Tehran is the capital and largest city of Iran, serving as the country’s political, economic, and cultural center.

sections.title: Currency
sections.content: The official currency of Iran is the Iranian rial (IRR).

sections.title: Language
sections.content: The official language is Persian (Farsi). Several regional languages are also spoken, including Azerbaijani, Kurdish, and Arabic.

sections.title: Traditional Food
sections.content: Iranian cuisine is known for its balance of flavors, herbs, and spices, with popular dishes such as kebab, ghormeh sabzi, and fesenjan.

sections.title: Geography
sections.content: Iran has diverse geography that includes deserts, fertile plains, mountain ranges like the Zagros and Alborz Mountains, and coastlines along the Caspian Sea and the Persian Gulf.

sections.title: Culture
sections.content: Iranian culture is deeply rooted in Persian traditions, literature, poetry, and art. Hospitality, family values, and celebrations such as Nowruz play an important role in daily life.

sections.title: Tourism
sections.content: Tourist attractions include ancient sites like Persepolis, historic cities such as Isfahan and Shiraz, beautiful mosques, and traditional bazaars.

sections.title: Fun Fact
sections.content: Iran celebrates Nowruz, the Persian New Year, which has been observed for over 3,000 years.

history.event: The Achaemenid Empire was founded by Cyrus the Great, becoming one of the largest empires in ancient history.
Alexander the Great conquered the Persian Empire, leading to Hellenistic influence in the region.
The Sasanian Empire ruled Persia, marking a peak in Persian culture, architecture, and governance.
Arab Muslim forces conquered Persia, introducing Islam to the region.
The Safavid Dynasty established Shi’a Islam as the state religion of Iran.
The Qajar Dynasty came to power, ruling Iran during a period of internal and foreign challenges.
Reza Shah founded the Pahlavi Dynasty, initiating modernization reforms.
The Iranian Revolution led to the establishment of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
